item.title: Mentioned by CanIndia News
item.description:
MP Gosal committed to advancing amateur sport
Bal Gosal considers himself a true sportsman. After a month as Canada's Minister of State (Sport) Bramalea-Gore-Malton MP Bal Gosal was startled to discover that physical education is mandatory in the province of Gosal_May31 Manitoba and thinks it ...

item.title: Mentioned by Ottawa Citizen
item.description:
National Hockey Day back on Parliament's agenda — for now
"The whole intention is to encourage people to get out to their local hockey rink, or flood a rink in the backyard . . . and invite the neighbours over and have everybody come out and have fun," says Alberta MP Linda Duncan. ... Robert Lynch, a spokesman for minister of state for sport Bal Gosal, said the government will “take a look at any proposal to help get kids active and promote sports in Canada,” but argues the “rules of the House” mean it'll probably be “many years” before this particular bill gets debated.

item.title: Mentioned by Toronto Star
item.description:
Pandas in Toronto: Pampered pair to get VIP treatment at Pearson
They were greeted by a respectably-sized posse that included then-Premier Dalton McGuinty, Lt.-Gov. David Onley, Mississauga Mayor Hazel McCallion, MPP Jagmeet Singh, MP Bal Gosal, and of course, a young girl bearing flowers. Media snapped photos.
